title: SignalK
description: Root schema of Signal K. Contains the list of vessels plus a reference to the local boat (also contained in the vessels list).

self.description: This holds the context (prefix + UUID, MMSI or URL in dot notation) of the server's self object.

vessels.description: A wrapper object for vessel objects, each describing vessels in range, including this vessel.

(^urn:mrn:(imo:mmsi:[2-7][0-9]{8}$|signa.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the vessel. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:230099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

aircraft.description: A wrapper object for aircraft, primarily intended for SAR aircraft in relation to marine search and rescue. For clarity about seaplanes etc, if it CAN fly, its an aircraft.

(^urn:mrn:(imo:mmsi:1[0-9]{8}$|signalk:u.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the aircraft. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:111099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

aton.description: A wrapper object for Aids to Navigation (aton's)

(^urn:mrn:(imo:mmsi:99[0-9]{7}$|signalk:.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the aid to navigation. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:991099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

sar.description: A wrapper object for Search And Rescue (SAR) MMSI's usied in transponders. MOB, EPIRBS etc

(^urn:mrn:(imo:mmsi:97[0-9]{7}$|signalk:.description: This regex pattern is used for validation of an MMSI or Signal K UUID identifier for the aid to navigation. Examples: urn:mrn:imo:mmsi:972099999 urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:c0d79334-4e25-4245-8892-54e8ccc8021d

sources.description: Metadata about the data sources; physical interface, address, protocol, etc.

resources.description: Resources to aid in navigation and operation of the vessel including waypoints, routes, notes, etc.

version.description: Version of the schema and APIs that this data is using in Canonical format i.e. V1.0.0.
